column10: Car failed to yield to crosswalk.
Driver turning right never looked right for pedestrians or cyclist. I and a pedestrian were nearly hit as the driver rolled through the red light during while the crosswalk light was illuminated.

Construction project has removed all markings for crosswalk leaving cyclists and pedestrians unprotected. This is the third day in a row I have had a near miss with vehicles rolling into or parked in the crosswalk while the crossing signal was activated.

Cars repeatedly fail to stop at the stop sign on Burgundy Road leading onto East Drive. Drivers roll through the stop sign to make a right turn on their way to the Beltway. On several occasions, including today, I have almost been hit when trying to cross the street here. Cars are not looking right for pedestrians because they are focused looking left at road traffic.
